unnormalised: ## Oh no, did your cart run away to Goa?! (Cart Abandonment Woes)
normalised: ## Oh no, did your cart run away to Goa?! (Cart Abandonment Woes)

unnormalised: We've all been there, haven't we? Browsing through Myntra at 2 AM, adding that perfect Kurti for Diwali (Rs. 1,299!), a funky phone cover (Rs. 499!), and maybe even a new pair of jhumkas (Rs. 799!). Then, suddenly, a phone call from your distant chacha demanding help with his internet connection in Kanpur, and BAM! You're distracted. You never complete the purchase. Your cart, like Rahul from Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, gets... abandoned.
normalised: We've all been there, haven't we? Browsing through Myntra at two A M, adding that perfect Kurti for Diwali (rupee one thousand two hundred and ninety nine!), a funky phone cover (rupee four hundred and ninety nine!), and maybe even a new pair of jhumkas (rupee seven hundred and ninety nine!). Then, suddenly, a phone call from your distant chacha demanding help with his internet connection in Kanpur, and B A M! You're distracted. You never complete the purchase. Your cart, like Rahul from Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, gets... abandoned.

unnormalised: Cart abandonment. The bane of every e-commerce retailer in India, from your neighbourhood kirana store going digital to the giants like Flipkart. It’s the digital equivalent of walking into a Lajpat Nagar shop, picking out a dozen sarees, haggling for 15 minutes, and then declaring, "Nahin, aaj mood nahin hai!" and walking out. Savage, right?
normalised: Cart abandonment. The bane of every e-commerce retailer in India, from your neighborhood kirana store going digital to the giants like Flipkart. It’s the digital equivalent of walking into a Lajpat Nagar shop, picking out a dozen sarees, haggling for fifteen minutes, and then declaring, "Nahin, aaj mood nahin hai!" and walking out. Savage, right?

unnormalised: But why, oh why, do we do this to poor online retailers? Are we secretly plotting against them? Are we all, deep down, villains inspired by Mogambo from Mr. India, cackling at their potential lost revenue? (Okay, maybe a *little* bit. Just kidding!).
normalised: But why, oh why, do we do this to poor online retailers? Are we secretly plotting against them? Are we all, deep down, villains inspired by Mogambo from Mister India, cackling at their potential lost revenue? (Okay, maybe a *little* bit. Just kidding!).

unnormalised: Possible reasons include: that pesky delivery charge that pops up at the last minute (seriously, Rs. 99 for delivering something 5 km down the road?!), having to create an account (ain't nobody got time for that!), or simply finding a better deal on Meesho. Or maybe you're like my roommate, Priya, who claims she adds things to her cart just for the thrill of it. She calls it "retail therapy reconnaissance".
normalised: Possible reasons include: that pesky delivery charge that pops up at the last minute (seriously, rupee ninety nine for delivering something five kilometer down the road?!), having to create an account (ain't nobody got time for that!), or simply finding a better deal on Meesho. Or maybe you're like my roommate, Priya, who claims she adds things to her cart just for the thrill of it. She calls it "retail therapy reconnaissance".

unnormalised: Whatever the reason, cart abandonment is a problem. Retailers are tearing their hair out faster than students at IIT Delhi during exam week. But fear not, retailers! There are ways to win back your wandering customers! Think friendly reminder emails, irresistible discounts, and maybe even a personalized message featuring Shah Rukh Khan saying, "Come back, Simran! Your cart is waiting!" (Okay, that last one might be a *tad* expensive.)
normalised: Whatever the reason, cart abandonment is a problem. Retailers are tearing their hair out faster than students at I I T Delhi during exam week. But fear not, retailers! There are ways to win back your wandering customers! Think friendly reminder emails, irresistible discounts, and maybe even a personalized message featuring Shah Rukh Khan saying, "Come back, Simran! Your cart is waiting!" (Okay, that last one might be a *tad* expensive.)

unnormalised: So next time you find yourself filling up a virtual shopping cart, remember the poor retailers and hit that "Checkout" button! Unless, of course, your chacha calls again. Then, all bets are off.
normalised: So next time you find yourself filling up a virtual shopping cart, remember the poor retailers and hit that "Checkout" button! Unless, of course, your chacha calls again. Then, all bets are off.
